arabic_text: ٱقۡتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمۡ وَهُمۡ فِي غَفۡلَةٖ مُّعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 21.1 Aqtaraba Lilnnāsi Ĥisābuhum Wa Hum Fī Ghaflatin Mu`riđūna

translations.english_saheeh: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Draws near for mankind their reckoning, while they turn away in heedlessness.
translations.english_rwwad: The reckoning of the people has drawn near, yet they are turning away heedlessly.

arabic_text: مَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّن رَّبِّهِم مُّحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا ٱسۡتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمۡ يَلۡعَبُونَ
phonetic: 21.2 Mā Ya'tīhim Min Dhikrin Min Rabbihim Muĥdathin 'Illā Astama`ūhu Wa Hum Yal`abūna

translations.english_saheeh: No mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play
translations.english_hilali_khan: Comes not unto them an admonition (a chapter of the Qur’ân) from their Lord as a recent revelation but they listen to it while they play
translations.english_rwwad: Whenever new revelation comes to them from their Lord, they listen to it in jest,

arabic_text: لَاهِيَةٗ قُلُوبُهُمۡۗ وَأَسَرُّواْ ٱلنَّجۡوَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ هَلۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُكُمۡۖ أَفَتَأۡتُونَ ٱلسِّحۡرَ وَأَنتُمۡ تُبۡصِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.3 Lāhiyatan Qulūbuhum Wa 'Asarrū An-Najwá Al-Ladhīna Žalamū Hal Hādhā 'Illā Basharun Mithlukum 'Afata'tūna As-Siĥra Wa 'Antum Tubşirūna

translations.english_saheeh: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: With their hearts occupied (with evil things). Those who do wrong, conceal their private counsels, (saying): "Is this (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) more than a human being like you? Will you submit to magic while you see it?"
translations.english_rwwad: with their hearts heedless. The wrongdoers whisper to one another in secret, “Is this but a human being just like yourselves? Will you then follow his magic, although you openly see?”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّي يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡقَوۡلَ فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
phonetic: 21.4 Qāla Rabbī Ya`lamu Al-Qawla Fī As-Samā'i Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Huwa As-Samī`u Al-`Alīmu

translations.english_saheeh: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) said: "My Lord knows (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth. And He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord knows every word spoken in the heavens and earth, for He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.”

arabic_text: بَلۡ قَالُوٓاْ أَضۡغَٰثُ أَحۡلَٰمِۭ بَلِ ٱفۡتَرَىٰهُ بَلۡ هُوَ شَاعِرٞ فَلۡيَأۡتِنَا بِـَٔايَةٖ كَمَآ أُرۡسِلَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ
phonetic: 21.5 Bal Qālū 'Ađghāthu 'Aĥlāmin Bal Aftarāhu Bal Huwa Shā`irun Falya'tinā Bi'āyatin Kamā 'Ursila Al-'Awwalūna

translations.english_saheeh: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, they say: "These (revelations of the Qur’ân which are revealed to Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are mixed up false dreams! Nay, he has invented them! - Nay, he is a poet! Let him then bring us an Ayâh (sign as a proof) like the ones (Prophets) the former were sent (with)!"
translations.english_rwwad: Yet they say, “This [Qur’an] is a set of jumbled dreams! Rather, he has fabricated it! Rather, he is a poet! So let him bring us a sign such as the earlier messengers were sent with.”

arabic_text: مَآ ءَامَنَتۡ قَبۡلَهُم مِّن قَرۡيَةٍ أَهۡلَكۡنَٰهَآۖ أَفَهُمۡ يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 21.6 Mā 'Āmanat Qablahum Min Qaryatin 'Ahlaknāhā 'Afahum Yu'uminūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [872]- Even though they had witnessed signs and miracles.

translations.english_saheeh: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them,[872] so will they believe?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Not one of the towns (populations), of those which We destroyed, believed before them (though We sent them signs): will they then believe?
translations.english_rwwad: Not a single town We destroyed before them believed [after receiving signs]; will they then believe?

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا قَبۡلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالٗا نُّوحِيٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡۖ فَسۡـَٔلُوٓاْ أَهۡلَ ٱلذِّكۡرِ إِن كُنتُمۡ لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 21.7 Wa Mā 'Arsalnā Qablaka 'Illā Rijālāan Nūĥī 'Ilayhim Fās'alū 'Ahla Adh-Dhikri 'In Kuntum Lā Ta`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We sent not before you, [O Muḥammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures] if you do not know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We sent not before you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) but men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the Reminder [Scriptures - the Taurât (Torah), the Injeel (Gospel)] if you do not know.
translations.english_rwwad: We did not send before you [O Prophet] except men to whom We gave revelation, so [O people] ask the People of the Scriptures if you do not know.

arabic_text: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ جَسَدٗا لَّا يَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُواْ خَٰلِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.8 Wa Mā Ja`alnāhum Jasadāan Lā Ya'kulūna Aţ-Ţa`āma Wa Mā Kānū Khālidīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [873]- Like the angels.  Rather, they were human beings with human attributes.

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not make them [i.e., the prophets] forms not eating food,[873] nor were they immortal [on earth].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We did not create them (the Messengers, with) bodies that ate not food, nor were they immortals.
translations.english_rwwad: We did not give them bodies that needed no food, nor were they immortal.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ صَدَقۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡوَعۡدَ فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُمۡ وَمَن نَّشَآءُ وَأَهۡلَكۡنَا ٱلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
phonetic: 21.9 Thumma Şadaqnāhumu Al-Wa`da Fa'anjaynāhum Wa Man Nashā'u Wa 'Ahlaknā Al-Musrifīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [874]- Once they had conveyed the message.

translations.english_saheeh: Then[874] We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We fulfilled to them the promise. So We saved them and those whom We willed, but We destroyed Al-Musrifûn (i.e. disbelievers in Allah, in His Messengers, extravagants, transgressors of Allâh’s limits by committing crimes, oppressions, polytheism and sins).
translations.english_rwwad: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them: We saved them and those whom We willed, and destroyed those who transgressed all bounds.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ أَنزَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ كِتَٰبٗا فِيهِ ذِكۡرُكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ
phonetic: 21.10 Laqad 'Anzalnā 'Ilaykum Kitābāan Fīhi Dhikrukum 'Afalā Ta`qilūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [875]- This implies the honor of having been mentioned or addressed.  Another meaning is "your reminder."

translations.english_saheeh: We have certainly sent down to you a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] in which is your mention.[875] Then will you not reason?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed, We have sent down for you (O mankind) a Book (the Qur’ân) in which there is Dhikrukum,(your Reminder or an honour for you i.e. honour for the one who follows the teaching of the Qur’ân and acts on its teachings). Will you not then understand?
translations.english_rwwad: We have sent down to you [O people] a Book in which there is honor for you. Do you not then understand?

arabic_text: وَكَمۡ قَصَمۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٖ كَانَتۡ ظَالِمَةٗ وَأَنشَأۡنَا بَعۡدَهَا قَوۡمًا ءَاخَرِينَ
phonetic: 21.11 Wa Kam Qaşamnā Min Qaryatin Kānat Žālimatan Wa 'Ansha'nā Ba`dahā Qawmāan 'Ākharīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [876]- i.e., its inhabitants persisting in wrongdoing.

translations.english_saheeh: And how many a city which was unjust[876] have We shattered and produced after it another people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: How many a town (community) given to wrong-doing, have We destroyed, and raised up after them another people!
translations.english_rwwad: [Imagine] how many towns of evildoers We have destroyed, and raised up after them another people!

arabic_text: فَلَمَّآ أَحَسُّواْ بَأۡسَنَآ إِذَا هُم مِّنۡهَا يَرۡكُضُونَ
phonetic: 21.12 Falammā 'Aĥassū Ba'sanā 'Idhā Hum Minhā Yarkuđūna

translations.english_saheeh: And when they [i.e., its inhabitants] perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when they perceived (saw) Our Torment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
translations.english_rwwad: When they sensed Our punishment, they started running away from it.

arabic_text: لَا تَرۡكُضُواْ وَٱرۡجِعُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَآ أُتۡرِفۡتُمۡ فِيهِ وَمَسَٰكِنِكُمۡ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُسۡـَٔلُونَ
phonetic: 21.13 Lā Tarkuđū Wa Arji`ū 'Ilá Mā 'Utriftum Fīhi Wa Masākinikum La`allakum Tus'alūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [877]- About what happened to you.  This is said to them in sarcasm and ridicule.

translations.english_saheeh: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."[877]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Flee not, but return to that wherein you lived a luxurious life, and to your homes, in order that you may be questioned.
translations.english_rwwad: “Do not run away, but return to your luxuries and dwellings, perhaps you will be questioned.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.14 Qālū Yā Waylanā 'Innā Kunnā Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They cried: "Woe to us! Certainly we have been Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong-doers and disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh)."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: فَمَا زَالَت تِّلۡكَ دَعۡوَىٰهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ حَصِيدًا خَٰمِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.15 Famā Zālat Tilka Da`wāhum Ĥattá Ja`alnāhum Ĥaşīdāan Khāmidīna

translations.english_saheeh: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is reaped, extinct (dead).
translations.english_rwwad: They kept crying out loud this until We mowed them down, lifeless.

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا لَٰعِبِينَ
phonetic: 21.16 Wa Mā Khalaqnā As-Samā'a Wa Al-'Arđa Wa Mā Baynahumā Lā`ibīna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.21:16) All the creation of the heavens and the earth is a proof for mankind to learn a lesson and know that the only Creator and the only Organizer of all this universe is One (Allâh), Lâ ilâha illallâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh, Who has no partners with Him).

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.
translations.english_hilali_khan: We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them for a (mere) play.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: We did not create the heavens and earth and all that is between them for fun.

arabic_text: لَوۡ أَرَدۡنَآ أَن نَّتَّخِذَ لَهۡوٗا لَّٱتَّخَذۡنَٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّآ إِن كُنَّا فَٰعِلِينَ
phonetic: 21.17 Law 'Aradnā 'An Nattakhidha Lahwan Lāttakhadhnāhu Min Ladunnā 'In Kunnā Fā`ilīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [878]- Such as a wife or a child.

translations.english_saheeh: Had We intended to take a diversion,[878] We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Had We intended to take a pastime (i.e. a wife or a son), We could surely have taken it from Us, if We were going to do (that).
translations.english_rwwad: If We had wished for a pastime, We could have had it from Our own, if We were to do so.

arabic_text: بَلۡ نَقۡذِفُ بِٱلۡحَقِّ عَلَى ٱلۡبَٰطِلِ فَيَدۡمَغُهُۥ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٞۚ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡوَيۡلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ
phonetic: 21.18 Bal Naqdhifu Bil-Ĥaqqi `Alá Al-Bāţili Fayadmaghuhu Fa'idhā Huwa Zāhiqun Wa Lakumu Al-Waylu Mimmā Taşifūna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[879]- Literally, "strikes its brain," disabling or killing it.
[880]- Of untruth concerning Allāh, particularly here, the claim that He has a son or other "partner" in divinity.

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it,[879] and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.[880]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, We fling (send down) the truth (this Qur’ân) against the falsehood (disbelief), so it destroys it, and behold, it (falsehood) is vanished. And woe to you for that (lie) which you ascribe (to Allâh by uttering that Allâh has a wife and a son).
translations.english_rwwad: Rather, We hurl the truth at falsehood, and it crushes it, so it vanishes. Woe to you for what you falsely ascribe [to Allah]!

arabic_text: وَلَهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَمَنۡ عِندَهُۥ لَا يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ عَنۡ عِبَادَتِهِۦ وَلَا يَسۡتَحۡسِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.19 Wa Lahu Man Fī As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Man `Indahu Lā Yastakbirūna `An `Ibādatihi Wa Lā Yastaĥsirūna

translations.english_saheeh: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him [i.e., the angels] are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and on earth. And those who are near Him (i.e. the angels) are not too proud to worship Him, nor are they weary (of His worship).
translations.english_rwwad: To Him belongs all those who are in the heavens and earth. Those [angels] who are with Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they ever grow weary.

arabic_text: يُسَبِّحُونَ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ لَا يَفۡتُرُونَ
phonetic: 21.20 Yusabbiĥūna Al-Layla Wa An-Nahāra Lā Yafturūna

translations.english_saheeh: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (i.e. the angels) glorify His Praises night and day, (and) they never slacken (to do so).
translations.english_rwwad: They glorify Him day and night tirelessly.

arabic_text: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُوٓاْ ءَالِهَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ هُمۡ يُنشِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.21 'Am Attakhadhū 'Ālihatan Mina Al-'Arđi Hum Yunshirūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they [i.e., men] taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they taken (for worship) âlihah (gods) from the earth who raise the dead?
translations.english_rwwad: Or have they taken gods from the earth who [cannot even] resurrect the dead?

arabic_text: لَوۡ كَانَ فِيهِمَآ ءَالِهَةٌ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَاۚ فَسُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَرۡشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
phonetic: 21.22 Law Kāna Fīhimā 'Ālihatun 'Illā Allāhu Lafasadatā Fasubĥāna Allāhi Rabbi Al-`Arshi `Ammā Yaşifūna

translations.english_saheeh: Had there been within them [i.e., the heavens and earth] gods besides Allāh, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allāh, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Had there been therein (in the heavens and the earth) âlihah (gods) besides Allâh, then verily both would have been ruined. Glorified be Allâh, the Lord of the Throne, (High is He) above all that (evil) they associate with Him!
translations.english_rwwad: If there had been gods besides Allah in the heavens and earth, both realms would have fallen in disorder. Glory be to Allah – Lord of the Throne – far above what they ascribe [to Him].

arabic_text: لَا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَمَّا يَفۡعَلُ وَهُمۡ يُسۡـَٔلُونَ
phonetic: 21.23 Lā Yus'alu `Ammā Yaf`alu Wa Hum Yus'alūna

translations.english_saheeh: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He cannot be questioned as to what He does, while they will be questioned.
translations.english_rwwad: He cannot be questioned for what He does, but they will be questioned.

arabic_text: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُواْ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةٗۖ قُلۡ هَاتُواْ بُرۡهَٰنَكُمۡۖ هَٰذَا ذِكۡرُ مَن مَّعِيَ وَذِكۡرُ مَن قَبۡلِيۚ بَلۡ أَكۡثَرُهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ ٱلۡحَقَّۖ فَهُم مُّعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 21.24 'Am Attakhadhū Min Dūnihi 'Ālihatan Qul Hātū Burhānakum Hādhā Dhikru Man Ma`iya Wa Dhikru Man Qablī Bal 'Aktharuhum Lā Ya`lamūna Al-Ĥaqqa Fahum Mu`riđūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [881]- All previous prophets called for the worship of Allāh alone.

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muḥammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur’ān] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me."[881] But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they taken for worship (other) âlihah (gods) besides Him? Say: "Bring your proof." This (the Qur’ân) is the Reminder for those with me and the Reminder for those before me. But most of them know not the Truth, so they are averse.
translations.english_rwwad: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say, “Bring your proof. Here is the Book of those who are with me, and the Book of those who came before me.” Yet most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِيٓ إِلَيۡهِ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱعۡبُدُونِ
phonetic: 21.25 Wa Mā 'Arsalnā Min Qablika Min Rasūl 'Iinillā Nūĥī 'Ilayhi 'Annahu Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā 'Anā Fā`budūni

translations.english_saheeh: And We sent not before you any messenger except We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We did not send any Messenger before you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) but We revealed to him (saying): Lâ ilâha illa Ana [none has the right to be worshipped but I (Allâh)], so worship Me (Alone and none else)."
translations.english_rwwad: “We never sent before you [O Prophet] any messenger without revealing to him that none has the right to be worshiped except Me, so worship Me.”

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَلَدٗاۗ سُبۡحَٰنَهُۥۚ بَلۡ عِبَادٞ مُّكۡرَمُونَ
phonetic: 21.26 Wa Qālū Attakhadha Ar-Raĥmānu Waladāan Subĥānahu Bal `Ibādun Mukramūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [882]- Those they claim to be "children" of Allāh, such as the angels, Ezra, Jesus, etc.

translations.english_saheeh: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they[882] are [but] honored servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they say: "The Most Gracious (Allâh) has begotten a son (or children)." Glory to Him! They [whom they call children of Allâh i.e. the angels, ‘Îsâ (Jesus) - son of Maryam (Mary), ‘Uzair (Ezra)], are but honoured slaves.
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “The Most Compassionate has begotten offspring!” Glory be to Him! In fact, those [angels] are His honored slaves.

arabic_text: لَا يَسۡبِقُونَهُۥ بِٱلۡقَوۡلِ وَهُم بِأَمۡرِهِۦ يَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 21.27 Lā Yasbiqūnahu Bil-Qawli Wa Hum Bi'amrihi Ya`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They speak not until He has spoken, and they act on His Command.
translations.english_rwwad: They do not speak before He speaks, and they only do as He commands.

arabic_text: يَعۡلَمُ مَا بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَمَا خَلۡفَهُمۡ وَلَا يَشۡفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ وَهُم مِّنۡ خَشۡيَتِهِۦ مُشۡفِقُونَ
phonetic: 21.28 Ya`lamu Mā Bayna 'Aydīhim Wa Mā Khalfahum Wa Lā Yashfa`ūna 'Illā Limani Artađá Wa Hum Min Khashyatihi Mushfiqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [883]- See footnote to 2:255.

translations.english_saheeh: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them,[883] and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for him with whom He is pleased. And they stand in awe for fear of Him.
translations.english_rwwad: He knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. They cannot intercede except for whom He pleases, and they are fearful in awe of Him.

arabic_text: ۞ وَمَن يَقُلۡ مِنۡهُمۡ إِنِّيٓ إِلَٰهٞ مِّن دُونِهِۦ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.29 Wa Man Yaqul Minhum 'Innī 'Ilahun Min Dūnihi Fadhālika Najzīhi Jahannama Kadhālika Najzī Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him" - that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if any of them should say: "Verily, I am an ilâh (a god) besides Him (Allâh)," such a one We should recompense with Hell. Thus We recompense the Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers).
translations.english_rwwad: If anyone of them were to say, “I am god besides Him,” We would punish him with Hell. This is how We punish the wrongdoers.

arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ كَانَتَا رَتۡقٗا فَفَتَقۡنَٰهُمَاۖ وَجَعَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمَآءِ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ حَيٍّۚ أَفَلَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 21.30 'Awalam Yará Al-Ladhīna Kafarū 'Anna As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđa Kānatā Ratqāan Fafataqnāhumā Wa Ja`alnā Mina Al-Mā'i Kulla Shay'in Ĥayyin 'Afalā Yu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and then We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were joined together as one united piece, then We parted them? And We have made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
translations.english_rwwad: Are the disbelievers not aware that the heavens and earth were joined together and then We split them apart? We created from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ رَوَٰسِيَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِهِمۡ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجٗا سُبُلٗا لَّعَلَّهُمۡ يَهۡتَدُونَ
phonetic: 21.31 Wa Ja`alnā Fī Al-'Arđi Rawāsiya 'An Tamīda Bihim Wa Ja`alnā Fīhā Fijājāan Subulāan La`allahum Yahtadūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have placed on the earth firm mountains, lest it should shake with them, and We placed therein broad highways for them to pass through, that they may be guided.
translations.english_rwwad: We have set on the earth firm mountains so it does not shake with them, and We have made therein broad pathways so that they may find their way.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ سَقۡفٗا مَّحۡفُوظٗاۖ وَهُمۡ عَنۡ ءَايَٰتِهَا مُعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 21.32 Wa Ja`alnā As-Samā'a Saqfāan Maĥfūžāan Wa Hum `An 'Āyātihā Mu`riđūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [884]- The signs present in the heavens.

translations.english_saheeh: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs,[884] are turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have made the heaven a roof, safe and well guarded. Yet they turn away from its signs (i.e. sun, moon, winds, clouds, etc.).
translations.english_rwwad: And We have made the sky a well-protected canopy, yet they turn away from its signs.

arabic_text: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمۡسَ وَٱلۡقَمَرَۖ كُلّٞ فِي فَلَكٖ يَسۡبَحُونَ
phonetic: 21.33 Wa Huwa Al-Ladhī Khalaqa Al-Layla Wa An-Nahāra Wa Ash-Shamsa Wa Al-Qamara Kullun Fī Falakin Yasbaĥūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And He it is Who has created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, each in an orbit floating.
translations.english_rwwad: It is He Who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon – each floating in its orbit.

arabic_text: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا لِبَشَرٖ مِّن قَبۡلِكَ ٱلۡخُلۡدَۖ أَفَإِيْن مِّتَّ فَهُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِدُونَ
phonetic: 21.34 Wa Mā Ja`alnā Libasharin Min Qablika Al-Khulda 'Afa'īn Mitta Fahumu Al-Khālidūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We granted not to any human being immortality before you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): then if you die, would they live forever?
translations.english_rwwad: We did not grant immortality to any human being before you [O Prophet]. So if you die, will they live forever?

arabic_text: كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ ذَآئِقَةُ ٱلۡمَوۡتِۗ وَنَبۡلُوكُم بِٱلشَّرِّ وَٱلۡخَيۡرِ فِتۡنَةٗۖ وَإِلَيۡنَا تُرۡجَعُونَ
phonetic: 21.35 Kullu Nafsin Dhā'iqatu Al-Mawti Wa Nablūkum Bish-Sharri Wa Al-Khayri Fitnatan Wa 'Ilaynā Turja`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Everyone is going to taste death, and We shall make a trial of you with evil and with good. And to Us you will be returned.
translations.english_rwwad: Every soul will taste death; We test you with bad and good as a trial, then to Us you will all be returned.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا رَءَاكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓاْ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي يَذۡكُرُ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَهُم بِذِكۡرِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ هُمۡ كَٰفِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.36 Wa 'Idhā Ra'āka Al-Ladhīna Kafarū 'In Yattakhidhūnaka 'Illā Huzūan 'Ahadhā Al-Ladhī Yadhkuru 'Ālihatakum Wa Hum Bidhikri Ar-Raĥmāni Hum Kāfirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who mentions [i.e., insults] your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when those who disbelieved (in the Oneness of Allâh) see you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), they take you not except for mockery (saying): "Is this the one who talks (badly) about your gods?" While they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Gracious (Allâh). [Tafsir Al-Qurtubî].
translations.english_rwwad: When the disbelievers see you, they only take you in ridicule, [saying], “Is this the one who speaks ill of your gods?” while they reject even the mention of the Most Compassionate.

arabic_text: خُلِقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مِنۡ عَجَلٖۚ سَأُوْرِيكُمۡ ءَايَٰتِي فَلَا تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
phonetic: 21.37 Khuliqa Al-'Insānu Min `Ajalin Sa'urīkum 'Āyātī Falā Tasta`jilūni

translations.english_saheeh: Man was created of haste [i.e., impatience]. I will show you My signs [i.e., vengeance], so do not impatiently urge Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Man is created of haste. I will show you My Ayât (torments, proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). So ask Me not to hasten (them).
translations.english_rwwad: Man is created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not ask Me to hasten them.

arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
phonetic: 21.38 Wa Yaqūlūna Matá Hādhā Al-Wa`du 'In Kuntum Şādiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they say: "When will this promise (come to pass), if you are truthful."
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”

arabic_text: لَوۡ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَن وُجُوهِهِمُ ٱلنَّارَ وَلَا عَن ظُهُورِهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
phonetic: 21.39 Law Ya`lamu Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Ĥīna Lā Yakuffūna `An Wujūhihimu An-Nāra Wa Lā `An Žuhūrihim Wa Lā Hum Yunşarūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [885]- The completion of the sentence is understood to be "...they would not be asking in disbelief and ridicule to be shown the punishment."

translations.english_saheeh: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...[885]
translations.english_hilali_khan: If only those who disbelieved knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs, and they will not be helped.
translations.english_rwwad: If only the disbelievers knew the moment when they will be unable to ward the Fire off their faces or their backs, nor will they be helped.

arabic_text: بَلۡ تَأۡتِيهِم بَغۡتَةٗ فَتَبۡهَتُهُمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنظَرُونَ
phonetic: 21.40 Bal Ta'tīhim Baghtatan Fatabhatuhum Falā Yastaţī`ūna Raddahā Wa Lā Hum Yunžarūna

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, it (the Fire or the Day of Resurrection) will come upon them all of a sudden and will perplex them, and they will have no power to avert it nor will they get respite.
translations.english_rwwad: Rather, it will come upon them suddenly and stun them; they will not be able to avert it, nor will they be given respite.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدِ ٱسۡتُهۡزِئَ بِرُسُلٖ مِّن قَبۡلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِٱلَّذِينَ سَخِرُواْ مِنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
phonetic: 21.41 Wa Laqadi Astuhzi'a Birusulin Min Qablika Faĥāqa Bial-Ladhīna Sakhirū Minhum Mā Kānū Bihi Yastahzi'ūn

translations.english_saheeh: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed, (many) Messengers were mocked before you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), but the scoffers were surrounded by that, whereat they used to mock.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there were messengers before you who were ridiculed, but those who mocked them were encompassed by what they used to ridicule.

arabic_text: قُلۡ مَن يَكۡلَؤُكُم بِٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ مِنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِم مُّعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 21.42 Qul Man Yakla'uukum Bil-Layli Wa An-Nahāri Mina Ar-Raĥmāni Bal Hum `An Dhikri Rabbihim Mu`riđūna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "Who can guard and protect you in the night or in the day from the (punishment of the) Most Gracious (Allâh)?" Nay, but they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “Who can protect you by night and by day against the Most Compassionate?” Yet they turn away from the admonition of their Lord.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ ءَالِهَةٞ تَمۡنَعُهُم مِّن دُونِنَاۚ لَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ نَصۡرَ أَنفُسِهِمۡ وَلَا هُم مِّنَّا يُصۡحَبُونَ
phonetic: 21.43 'Am Lahum 'Ālihatun Tamna`uhum Min Dūninā Lā Yastaţī`ūna Naşra 'Anfusihim Wa Lā Hum Minnā Yuşĥabūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they âlihah (gods) who can guard them from Us? They have no power to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us (i.e. from Our Torment).
translations.english_rwwad: Do they have gods who can defend them against Us? They cannot even help themselves, nor will they be protected from Us.

arabic_text: بَلۡ مَتَّعۡنَا هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَءَابَآءَهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡعُمُرُۗ أَفَلَا يَرَوۡنَ أَنَّا نَأۡتِي ٱلۡأَرۡضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنۡ أَطۡرَافِهَآۚ أَفَهُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
phonetic: 21.44 Bal Matta`nā Hā'uulā' Wa 'Ābā'ahum Ĥattá Ţāla `Alayhimu Al-`Umuru 'Afalā Yarawna 'Annā Na'tī Al-'Arđa Nanquşuhā Min 'Aţrāfihā 'Afahumu Al-Ghālibūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [886]- See footnote to 13:41.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.21:44). "See they not that We gradually reduce the land (of disbelievers, by giving it to the believers, in war victories) from its outlying borders. And Allâh judges, there is none to put back His Judgement and He is Swift at reckoning." [The Qur’ân, Verse 13:41]

translations.english_saheeh: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders?[886] Is it they who will overcome?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, We gave the luxuries of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them. See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will overcome?[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Nevertheless, We have provided for them and their forefathers luxuries which they enjoyed for a long time. Do they not see that We gradually reduce the land from its outlying sides? Is it they who will then prevail?

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أُنذِرُكُم بِٱلۡوَحۡيِۚ وَلَا يَسۡمَعُ ٱلصُّمُّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا مَا يُنذَرُونَ
phonetic: 21.45 Qul 'Innamā 'Undhirukum Bil-Waĥyi Wa Lā Yasma`u Aş-Şummu Ad-Du`ā'a 'Idhā Mā Yundharūna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "I warn you only by the revelation (from Allâh and not by the opinion of the religious scholars and others). But the deaf (who follow the religious scholars and others blindly) will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned [i.e. one should follow only the Qur’ân and the Sunnah (legal ways, orders, acts of worship, and the statements of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم, as the companions of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم did)][1].
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “I only warn you by divine revelation.” But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned.

arabic_text: وَلَئِن مَّسَّتۡهُمۡ نَفۡحَةٞ مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَٰوَيۡلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.46 Wa La'in Massat/hum Nafĥatun Min `Adhābi Rabbika Layaqūlunna Yā Waylanā 'Innā Kunnā Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if a breath (minor calamity) of the Torment of your Lord touches them, they will surely cry: "Woe unto us! Indeed we have been Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: If a mere breath of your Lord’s torment were to touch them, they would surely say, “Woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: وَنَضَعُ ٱلۡمَوَٰزِينَ ٱلۡقِسۡطَ لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ فَلَا تُظۡلَمُ نَفۡسٞ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ وَإِن كَانَ مِثۡقَالَ حَبَّةٖ مِّنۡ خَرۡدَلٍ أَتَيۡنَا بِهَاۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِنَا حَٰسِبِينَ
phonetic: 21.47 Wa Nađa`u Al-Mawāzīna Al-Qisţa Liyawmi Al-Qiyāmati Falā Tužlamu Nafsun Shay'āan Wa 'In Kāna Mithqāla Ĥabbatin Min Khardalin 'Ataynā Bihā Wa Kafá Binā Ĥāsibīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [887]- i.e., anything as small or insignificant as a mustard seed.

translations.english_saheeh: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed,[887] We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We shall set up balances of justice on the Day of Resurrection, then none will be dealt with unjustly in anything. And if there be the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it. And Sufficient are We to take account.
translations.english_rwwad: We will place the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection, and no soul will be wronged in the least. Even if a deed is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. Sufficient are We as Reckoners.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ ٱلۡفُرۡقَانَ وَضِيَآءٗ وَذِكۡرٗا لِّلۡمُتَّقِينَ
phonetic: 21.48 Wa Laqad 'Ātaynā Mūsá Wa Hārūna Al-Furqāna Wa Điyā'an Wa Dhikrāan Lilmuttaqīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [888]- These are three qualities of the Torah.

translations.english_saheeh: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder[888] for the righteous
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We granted to Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron) the criterion (of right and wrong), and a shining light [i.e. the Taurât (Torah)] and a Reminder for Al-Muttaqûn (the pious - See V.2:2).
translations.english_rwwad: We certainly gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a shining light and admonition for the righteous,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَخۡشَوۡنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَهُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّاعَةِ مُشۡفِقُونَ
phonetic: 21.49 Al-Ladhīna Yakhshawna Rabbahum Bil-Ghaybi Wa Hum Mina As-Sā`ati Mushfiqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [889]- Which can mean "Him being unseen" by them or "though they are unseen" by others.

translations.english_saheeh: Who fear their Lord unseen,[889] while they are of the Hour apprehensive.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who fear their Lord without seeing Him, and they are afraid of the Hour.
translations.english_rwwad: those who fear their Lord without seeing Him, and are apprehensive of the Hour.

arabic_text: وَهَٰذَا ذِكۡرٞ مُّبَارَكٌ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُۚ أَفَأَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.50 Wa Hadhā Dhikrun Mubārakun 'Anzalnāhu 'Afa'antum Lahu Munkirūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [890]- i.e., pretending ignorance, disapproving or refusing to acknowledge it?
footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.21:50).
a) See the footnote of (V.10:37).
b) See the footnote of (V.3:85).

translations.english_saheeh: And this [Qur’ān] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?[890]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And this is a blessed Reminder (the Qur’ân) which We have sent down: will you then (dare to) deny it?[2]
translations.english_rwwad: And this [Qur’an] is a blessed reminder which We have sent down. Are you still denying it?

arabic_text: ۞ وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَآ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ رُشۡدَهُۥ مِن قَبۡلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِۦ عَٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.51 Wa Laqad 'Ātaynā 'Ibrāhīma Rushdahu Min Qablu Wa Kunnā Bihi `Ālimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [891]- i.e., before Moses.  Allāh had guided him from early youth.

translations.english_saheeh: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before,[891] and We were of him well-Knowing
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrâhîm (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We had given Abraham sound judgment before, for We know him well.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا هَٰذِهِ ٱلتَّمَاثِيلُ ٱلَّتِيٓ أَنتُمۡ لَهَا عَٰكِفُونَ
phonetic: 21.52 'Idh Qāla Li'abīhi Wa Qawmihi Mā Hadhihi At-Tamāthīlu Allatī 'Antum Lahā `Ākifūna

translations.english_saheeh: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these images, to which you are devoted?"
translations.english_rwwad: When he said to his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are so devoted?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا لَهَا عَٰبِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.53 Qālū Wajadnā 'Ābā'anā Lahā `Ābidīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "We found our fathers worshipping them."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We found our forefathers worshiping them.”

arabic_text: قَالَ لَقَدۡ كُنتُمۡ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُمۡ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ
phonetic: 21.54 Qāla Laqad Kuntum 'Antum Wa 'Ābā'uukum Fī Đalālin Mubīnin

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Indeed, you and your fathers have been in manifest error."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Indeed, you and your forefathers were clearly misguided.”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَجِئۡتَنَا بِٱلۡحَقِّ أَمۡ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱللَّٰعِبِينَ
phonetic: 21.55 Qālū 'Aji'tanā Bil-Ĥaqqi 'Am 'Anta Mina Al-Lā`ibīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Have you brought us the truth, or are you one of those who play about?"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Have you come to us with the truth, or are you joking?”

arabic_text: قَالَ بَل رَّبُّكُمۡ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ٱلَّذِي فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا۠ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّٰهِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.56 Qāla Bal Rabbukum Rabbu As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Al-Ladhī Faţarahunna Wa 'Anā `Alá Dhālikum Mina Ash-Shāhidīna

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them and to that I am one of the witnesses.
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and earth, Who created them, and I am one of those who bear witness to it.

arabic_text: وَتَٱللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصۡنَٰمَكُم بَعۡدَ أَن تُوَلُّواْ مُدۡبِرِينَ
phonetic: 21.57 Wa Tālllahi La'akīdanna 'Aşnāmakum Ba`da 'An Tuwallū Mudbirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [I swear] by Allāh, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And by Allâh, I shall plot a plan (to destroy) your idols after you have gone away and turned your backs."
translations.english_rwwad: By Allah, I will surely plot against your idols after you have turned and gone away.”

arabic_text: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ جُذَٰذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرٗا لَّهُمۡ لَعَلَّهُمۡ إِلَيۡهِ يَرۡجِعُونَ
phonetic: 21.58 Faja`alahum Judhādhāan 'Illā Kabīrāan Lahum La`allahum 'Ilayhi Yarji`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So he broke them to pieces, (all) except the biggest of them, that they might turn to it.
translations.english_rwwad: So he broke them into pieces, except the biggest of them, so that they might come back to it.

arabic_text: قَالُواْ مَن فَعَلَ هَٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَآ إِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.59 Qālū Man Fa`ala Hādhā Bi'ālihatinā 'Innahu Lamina Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Who has done this to our âlihah (gods)? He must indeed be one of the Zâlimun (wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Who has done this to our gods? He is indeed one of the wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ سَمِعۡنَا فَتٗى يَذۡكُرُهُمۡ يُقَالُ لَهُۥٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمُ
phonetic: 21.60 Qālū Sami`nā Fatáan Yadhkuruhum Yuqālu Lahu 'Ibrāhīmu

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "We heard a young man talking against them, who is called Ibrâhîm (Abraham)."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We heard a young man, speaking ill of them, who is called Abraham.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ فَأۡتُواْ بِهِۦ عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَشۡهَدُونَ
phonetic: 21.61 Qālū Fa'tū Bihi `Alá 'A`yuni An-Nāsi La`allahum Yash/hadūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [892]- To what they had heard him say.  It may also mean "...that they may witness [what will be done to him as punishment]."

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."[892]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may testify."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Bring him then before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness [his trial].”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ ءَأَنتَ فَعَلۡتَ هَٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَا يَٰٓإِبۡرَٰهِيمُ
phonetic: 21.62 Qālū 'A'anta Fa`alta Hādhā Bi'ālihatinā Yā 'Ibrāhīmu

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrâhîm (Abraham)?"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Are you the one who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

arabic_text: قَالَ بَلۡ فَعَلَهُۥ كَبِيرُهُمۡ هَٰذَا فَسۡـَٔلُوهُمۡ إِن كَانُواْ يَنطِقُونَ
phonetic: 21.63 Qāla Bal Fa`alahu Kabīruhum Hādhā Fās'alūhum 'In Kānū Yanţiqūna

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"[1]
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Rather, it was this biggest one who did it. So ask them, if they can speak!”

arabic_text: فَرَجَعُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمۡ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ أَنتُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ
phonetic: 21.64 Faraja`ū 'Ilá 'Anfusihim Faqālū 'Innakum 'Antumu Až-Žālimūna

translations.english_saheeh: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they turned to themselves and said: "Verily, you are the Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: So they turned back to one another, and said, “Indeed, it is you who are the wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: ثُمَّ نُكِسُواْ عَلَىٰ رُءُوسِهِمۡ لَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتَ مَا هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يَنطِقُونَ
phonetic: 21.65 Thumma Nukisū `Alá Ru'ūsihim Laqad `Alimta Mā Hā'uulā' Yanţiqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [893]- After first admitting their error, they were seized by pride and obstinacy.

translations.english_saheeh: Then they reversed themselves,[893] [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they turned to themselves (their first thought and said): "Indeed you [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] know well that these (idols) speak not!"
translations.english_rwwad: Then they turned to their obstinacy, [saying], “You already know that they cannot speak.”

arabic_text: قَالَ أَفَتَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمۡ
phonetic: 21.66 Qāla 'Afata`budūna Min Dūni Allāhi Mā Lā Yanfa`ukum Shay'āan Wa Lā Yađurrukum

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allāh that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allâh, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?
translations.english_rwwad: Abraham said, “Do you then worship besides Allah that which can neither benefit nor harm you in the least?

arabic_text: أُفّٖ لَّكُمۡ وَلِمَا تَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ
phonetic: 21.67 'Uffin Lakum Wa Limā Ta`budūna Min Dūni Allāhi 'Afalā Ta`qilūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [894]- An exclamation of anger and displeasure.

translations.english_saheeh: Uff[894] to you and to what you worship instead of Allāh. Then will you not use reason?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Fie upon you, and upon that which you worship besides Allâh! Have you then no sense?"
translations.english_rwwad: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship besides Allah! Do you not have any sense?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ حَرِّقُوهُ وَٱنصُرُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ فَٰعِلِينَ
phonetic: 21.68 Qālū Ĥarriqūhu Wa Anşurū 'Ālihatakum 'In Kuntum Fā`ilīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Burn him and help your âlihah (gods), if you will be doing."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Burn him and avenge your gods, if you must do something.”

arabic_text: قُلۡنَا يَٰنَارُ كُونِي بَرۡدٗا وَسَلَٰمًا عَلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ
phonetic: 21.69 Qulnā Yā Nāru Kūnī Bardāan Wa Salāmāan `Alá 'Ibrāhīma

translations.english_saheeh: We [i.e., Allāh] said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
translations.english_hilali_khan: We (Allâh) said: "O fire! Be you coolness and safety for Ibrâhîm (Abraham)!"
translations.english_rwwad: We said, “O fire, be cool and safe for Abraham.”

arabic_text: وَأَرَادُواْ بِهِۦ كَيۡدٗا فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡأَخۡسَرِينَ
phonetic: 21.70 Wa 'Arādū Bihi Kaydāan Faja`alnāhumu Al-'Akhsarīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the greatest losers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they wanted to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.
translations.english_rwwad: They plotted to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

arabic_text: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ٱلَّتِي بَٰرَكۡنَا فِيهَا لِلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 21.71 Wa Najjaynāhu Wa Lūţāan 'Ilá Al-'Arđi Allatī Bāraknā Fīhā Lil`ālamīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds [i.e., peoples].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We rescued him and Lût (Lot) to the land which We have blessed for the ‘Âlamîn (mankind and jinn).
translations.english_rwwad: And We saved him and Lot [and brought him] to the land [of Levant] that we have blessed for all people.

arabic_text: وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَ نَافِلَةٗۖ وَكُلّٗا جَعَلۡنَا صَٰلِحِينَ
phonetic: 21.72 Wa Wahabnā Lahu 'Isĥāqa Wa Ya`qūba Nāfilatan Wa Kullāan Ja`alnā Şāliĥīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We bestowed upon him Ishâq (Isaac), and (a grandson) Ya‘qûb (Jacob). Each one We made righteous.
translations.english_rwwad: And We gave him Isaac, and then Jacob, a grandson, and We made all of them righteous.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ أَئِمَّةٗ يَهۡدُونَ بِأَمۡرِنَا وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِمۡ فِعۡلَ ٱلۡخَيۡرَٰتِ وَإِقَامَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَإِيتَآءَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةِۖ وَكَانُواْ لَنَا عَٰبِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.73 Wa Ja`alnāhum 'A'immatan Yahdūna Bi'amrinā Wa 'Awĥaynā 'Ilayhim Fi`la Al-Khayrāti Wa 'Iqāma Aş-Şalāati Wa 'Ītā'a Az-Zakāati Wa Kānū Lanā `Ābidīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakāh; and they were worshippers of Us.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We made them leaders, guiding (mankind) by Our Command, and We revealed to them the doing of good deeds, performing Salât (Iqâmat-as-Salât), and the giving of Zakât and of Us (Alone) they were the worshippers.
translations.english_rwwad: And We made them leaders, guiding people by Our command, and We inspired them to do righteous deeds, establish prayer and give zakah; and they were Our true worshipers.

arabic_text: وَلُوطًا ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ حُكۡمٗا وَعِلۡمٗا وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلۡقَرۡيَةِ ٱلَّتِي كَانَت تَّعۡمَلُ ٱلۡخَبَٰٓئِثَۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمَ سَوۡءٖ فَٰسِقِينَ
phonetic: 21.74 Wa Lūţāan 'Ātaynāhu Ĥukmāan Wa `Ilmāan Wa Najjaynāhu Mina Al-Qaryati Allatī Kānat Ta`malu Al-Khabā'itha 'Innahum Kānū Qawma Saw'in Fāsiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Lût (Lot), We gave him Hukm (right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) and (religious) knowledge, and We saved him from the town (folk) who practised Al-Khabâ’ith (evil, wicked and filthy deeds). Verily, they were a people given to evil, and were Fâsiqûn (rebellious, disobedient to Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: To Lot We gave sound judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the town that was engrossed in shameful practices. They were Indeed an evil and rebellious people.

arabic_text: وَأَدۡخَلۡنَٰهُ فِي رَحۡمَتِنَآۖ إِنَّهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
phonetic: 21.75 Wa 'Adkhalnāhu Fī Raĥmatinā 'Innahu Mina Aş-Şāliĥīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We admitted him to Our Mercy; truly, he was of the righteous.
translations.english_rwwad: And We admitted him to Our mercy, for he was one of the righteous.

arabic_text: وَنُوحًا إِذۡ نَادَىٰ مِن قَبۡلُ فَٱسۡتَجَبۡنَا لَهُۥ فَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلۡكَرۡبِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
phonetic: 21.76 Wa Nūĥāan 'Idh Nādá Min Qablu Fāstajabnā Lahu Fanajjaynāhu Wa 'Ahlahu Mina Al-Karbi Al-`Ažīmi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [895]- i.e., supplicated against his people who had persisted in denial and animosity.  See 71:26-28.

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allāh][895] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great affliction [i.e., the flood].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Nûh (Noah), when he cried (to Us) aforetime. We answered his invocation and saved him and his family from the great distress.
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] Noah, when he called out to Us before, so We responded to him and saved him and his household from the great distress.

arabic_text: وَنَصَرۡنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمَ سَوۡءٖ فَأَغۡرَقۡنَٰهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
phonetic: 21.77 Wa Naşarnāhu Mina Al-Qawmi Al-Ladhīna Kadhabū Bi'āyātinā 'Innahum Kānū Qawma Saw'in Fa'aghraqnāhum 'Ajma`īna

translations.english_saheeh: And We aided [i.e., saved] him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
translations.english_hilali_khan: We helped him against the people who denied Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). Verily, they were a people given to evil. So We drowned them all.
translations.english_rwwad: And We helped him against the people who rejected Our signs. They were indeed an evil people, so We drowned them all.

arabic_text: وَدَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيۡمَٰنَ إِذۡ يَحۡكُمَانِ فِي ٱلۡحَرۡثِ إِذۡ نَفَشَتۡ فِيهِ غَنَمُ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ وَكُنَّا لِحُكۡمِهِمۡ شَٰهِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.78 Wa Dāwūda Wa Sulaymāna 'Idh Yaĥkumāni Fī Al-Ĥarthi 'Idh Nafashat Fīhi Ghanamu Al-Qawmi Wa Kunnā Liĥukmihim Shāhidīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [896]- Eating and destroying the crops.

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night],[896] and We were witness to their judgement.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Dâwûd (David) and Sulaimân (Solomon), when they gave judgement in the case of the field in which the sheep of certain people had pastured at night; and We were witness to their judgement.
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] David and Solomon, when they passed judgment about the tillage into which some people’s sheep had strayed at night, and We were witnesses to their judgment.

arabic_text: فَفَهَّمۡنَٰهَا سُلَيۡمَٰنَۚ وَكُلًّا ءَاتَيۡنَا حُكۡمٗا وَعِلۡمٗاۚ وَسَخَّرۡنَا مَعَ دَاوُۥدَ ٱلۡجِبَالَ يُسَبِّحۡنَ وَٱلطَّيۡرَۚ وَكُنَّا فَٰعِلِينَ
phonetic: 21.79 Fafahhamnāhā Sulaymāna Wa Kullāan 'Ātaynā Ĥukmāan Wa `Ilmāan Wa Sakhkharnā Ma`a Dāwūda Al-Jibāla Yusabbiĥna Wa Aţ-Ţayra Wa Kunnā Fā`ilīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [897]- Meaning that Allāh has always been capable of accomplishing whatever He wills.

translations.english_saheeh: And We gave understanding of it [i.e., the case] to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].[897]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We made Sulaimân (Solomon) to understand (the case); and to each of them We gave Hukm (right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains and the birds to glorify Our Praises along with Dâwûd (David). And it was We Who were the doer (of all these things).
translations.english_rwwad: We made Solomon understand it, although We gave each of them sound judgment and knowledge. We subjected the mountains and birds to glorify Allah along with David. It was We Who did all this.

arabic_text: وَعَلَّمۡنَٰهُ صَنۡعَةَ لَبُوسٖ لَّكُمۡ لِتُحۡصِنَكُم مِّنۢ بَأۡسِكُمۡۖ فَهَلۡ أَنتُمۡ شَٰكِرُونَ
phonetic: 21.80 Wa `Allamnāhu Şan`ata Labūsin Lakum Lituĥşinakum Min Ba'sikum Fahal 'Antum Shākirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We taught him the making of metal coats of mail (for battles), to protect you in your fighting. Are you then grateful?
translations.english_rwwad: And We taught him the art of making coats of mail for you to protect yourselves in your battle. Will you then be grateful?

arabic_text: وَلِسُلَيۡمَٰنَ ٱلرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةٗ تَجۡرِي بِأَمۡرِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ٱلَّتِي بَٰرَكۡنَا فِيهَاۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.81 Wa Lisulaymāna Ar-Rīĥa `Āşifatan Tajrī Bi'amrihi 'Ilá Al-'Arđi Allatī Bāraknā Fīhā Wa Kunnā Bikulli Shay'in `Ālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And to Sulaimân (Solomon) (We subjected) the wind strongly raging, running by his command towards the land which We had blessed. And of everything We are the All-Knower.
translations.english_rwwad: And to Solomon [We subjected] the raging wind, to blow by his command to the land We had blessed. It is We Who have full knowledge of everything.

arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ مَن يَغُوصُونَ لَهُۥ وَيَعۡمَلُونَ عَمَلٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمۡ حَٰفِظِينَ
phonetic: 21.82 Wa Mina Ash-Shayāţīni Man Yaghūşūna Lahu Wa Ya`malūna `Amalāan Dūna Dhālika Wa Kunnā Lahum Ĥāfižīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [898]- Preventing any disobedience or deviation by them from Solomon's instructions and protecting him from being harmed by them.

translations.english_saheeh: And of the devils [i.e., jinn] were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.[898]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And of the Shayâtîn (devils from the jinn) were some who dived for him, and did other work besides that; and it was We Who guarded them.
translations.english_rwwad: And among the devils [We subjected] those who dived for him and performed other duties. It is We Who were watching over them.

arabic_text: ۞ وَأَيُّوبَ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ ٱلضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرۡحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.83 Wa 'Ayyūba 'Idh Nādá Rabbahu 'Annī Massanī Ađ-Đurru Wa 'Anta 'Arĥamu Ar-Rāĥimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Ayyûb (Job), when he cried to his Lord: "Verily, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who show mercy."
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] Job, when he cried out to his Lord, “I have been struck by adversity, and You are the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.”

arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَجَبۡنَا لَهُۥ فَكَشَفۡنَا مَا بِهِۦ مِن ضُرّٖۖ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ أَهۡلَهُۥ وَمِثۡلَهُم مَّعَهُمۡ رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَا وَذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡعَٰبِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.84 Fāstajabnā Lahu Fakashafnā Mā Bihi Min Đurrin Wa 'Ātaynāhu 'Ahlahu Wa Mithlahum Ma`ahum Raĥmatan Min `Indinā Wa Dhikrá Lil`ābidīna

translations.english_saheeh: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We answered his call, and We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his family to him (that he had lost) and the like thereof along with them as a mercy from Ourselves and a Reminder for all those who worship Us.
translations.english_rwwad: So We responded to him and relieved his adversity, and We restored to him his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and as a reminder for Our worshipers.

arabic_text: وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَإِدۡرِيسَ وَذَا ٱلۡكِفۡلِۖ كُلّٞ مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
phonetic: 21.85 Wa 'Ismā`īla Wa 'Idrīsa Wa Dhā Al-Kifli Kullun Mina Aş-Şābirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Ismâ‘îl (Ishmael), and Idrîs (Enoch) and Dhul-Kifl (Isaiah): all were from among As-Sâbirûn (the patient).
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] Ishmael, Idrīs and Dhul-Kifl; they were all steadfast.

arabic_text: وَأَدۡخَلۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي رَحۡمَتِنَآۖ إِنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
phonetic: 21.86 Wa 'Adkhalnāhum Fī Raĥmatinā 'Innahum Mina Aş-Şāliĥīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We admitted them to Our Mercy. Verily, they were of the righteous.
translations.english_rwwad: And We admitted them to Our mercy, for they were truly righteous.

arabic_text: وَذَا ٱلنُّونِ إِذ ذَّهَبَ مُغَٰضِبٗا فَظَنَّ أَن لَّن نَّقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِي ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ أَن لَّآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنتَ سُبۡحَٰنَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.87 Wa Dhā An-Nūni 'Idh Dhahaba Mughāđibāan Fažanna 'An Lan Naqdira `Alayhi Fanādá Fī Až-Žulumāti 'An Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā 'Anta Subĥānaka 'Innī Kuntu Mina Až-Žālimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[899]- At the disbelief of his people.
[900]- Or "would not restrict him" in the belly of the fish.
[901]- That of the night, of the sea, and of the fish's interior.

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] the man of the fish [i.e., Jonah], when he went off in anger[899] and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him.[900] And he called out within the darknesses,[901] "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Dhun-Nûn (Jonah), when he went off in anger, and imagined that We shall not punish him (i.e. the calamities which had befallen him)! But he cried through the darkness (saying): Lâ ilâha illâ Anta [none has the right to be worshipped but You (O, Allâh)], Glorified (and Exalted) be You [above all that (evil) they associate with You]! Truly, I have been of the wrong-doers."
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] the Man of the Whale [Jonah] when he departed in anger, thinking that We would not take him to task. Then he cried out in the depths of darkness, “None has the right to be worshiped except You. Glory be to You! I have certainly done wrong”.

arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَجَبۡنَا لَهُۥ وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلۡغَمِّۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُـۨجِي ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 21.88 Fāstajabnā Lahu Wa Najjaynāhu Mina Al-Ghammi Wa Kadhalika Nunjī Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We answered his call, and delivered him from the distress. And thus We do deliver the believers (who believe in the Oneness of Allâh, abstain from evil and work righteousness).
translations.english_rwwad: So We answered his prayer and rescued him from distress. This is how We rescue the believers.

arabic_text: وَزَكَرِيَّآ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرۡنِي فَرۡدٗا وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡوَٰرِثِينَ
phonetic: 21.89 Wa Zakarīyā 'Idh Nādá Rabbahu Rabbi Lā Tadharnī Fardāan Wa 'Anta Khayru Al-Wārithīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while You are the best of inheritors."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) Zakariyyâ (Zachariah), when he cried to his Lord: "O My Lord! Leave me not single (childless), though You are the Best of the inheritors."
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] Zachariah, when he cried out to his Lord, “My Lord, do not leave me childless, for You are the Best of Inheritors.”

arabic_text: فَٱسۡتَجَبۡنَا لَهُۥ وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥ يَحۡيَىٰ وَأَصۡلَحۡنَا لَهُۥ زَوۡجَهُۥٓۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ يُسَٰرِعُونَ فِي ٱلۡخَيۡرَٰتِ وَيَدۡعُونَنَا رَغَبٗا وَرَهَبٗاۖ وَكَانُواْ لَنَا خَٰشِعِينَ
phonetic: 21.90 Fāstajabnā Lahu Wa Wahabnā Lahu Yaĥyá Wa 'Aşlaĥnā Lahu Zawjahu 'Innahum Kānū Yusāri`ūna Fī Al-Khayrāti Wa Yad`ūnanā Raghabāan Wa Rahabāan Wa Kānū Lanā Khāshi`īna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [902]- i.e., worship.

translations.english_saheeh: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate[902] Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We answered his call, and We bestowed upon him Yahyâ (John), and cured his wife (to bear a child) for him. Verily, they used to hasten on to do good deeds, and they used to call on Us with hope and fear, and used to humble themselves before Us.
translations.english_rwwad: So We answered his prayer and gave him John, and made his wife fertile. They used to hasten in doing good deeds and used to call upon Us with hope and fear, and they were humble before Us.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّتِيٓ أَحۡصَنَتۡ فَرۡجَهَا فَنَفَخۡنَا فِيهَا مِن رُّوحِنَا وَجَعَلۡنَٰهَا وَٱبۡنَهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 21.91 Wa A-Atī 'Aĥşanat Farjahā Fanafakhnā Fīhā Min Rūĥinā Wa Ja`alnāhā Wa Abnahā 'Āyatan Lil`ālamīna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.21:91) It is said that Jibrael (Gabriel) had merely breathed in the sleeve of Maryam’s (Mary) shirt and thus she conceived.

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity [i.e., Mary], so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And she who guarded her chastity [Virgin Maryam (Mary)]: We breathed into (the sleeves of) her (shirt or garment) [through Our Rûh - Jibrîl (Gabriel)],[1] and We made her and her son [‘Îsâ (Jesus)] a sign for Al-‘Âlamîn (the mankind and jinn).
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember Mary] who guarded her chastity; We breathed in her through Our spirit [Gabriel], and made her and her son a sign for all people.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمۡ أُمَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمۡ فَٱعۡبُدُونِ
phonetic: 21.92 'Inna Hadhihi 'Ummatukum 'Ummatan Wāĥidatan Wa 'Anā Rabbukum Fā`budūni

footnotes.english_saheeh: [903]- i.e., a collective way of life or course of conduct followed by a community.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion,[903] and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly! This, your Ummah [Shari‘ah or religion (Islâmic Monotheism)] is one religion, and I am your Lord, therefore worship Me (Alone). [Tafsîr Ibn Kathîr]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this religion of yours is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me alone.

arabic_text: وَتَقَطَّعُوٓاْ أَمۡرَهُم بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلٌّ إِلَيۡنَا رَٰجِعُونَ
phonetic: 21.93 Wa Taqaţţa`ū 'Amrahum Baynahum Kullun 'Ilaynā Rāji`ūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [904]- Becoming sects and denominations.

translations.english_saheeh: And [yet] they divided their affair [i.e., that of their religion] among themselves,[904] [but] all to Us will return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they have broken up and differed as regards their religion among themselves. (And) they all shall return to Us.
translations.english_rwwad: But people have divided themselves into sects; yet they will all return to Us.

arabic_text: فَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤۡمِنٞ فَلَا كُفۡرَانَ لِسَعۡيِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ كَٰتِبُونَ
phonetic: 21.94 Faman Ya`mal Mina Aş-Şāliĥāti Wa Huwa Mu'uminun Falā Kufrāna Lisa`yihi Wa 'Innā Lahu Kātibūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [905]- Such a person will not be deprived of his due reward.

translations.english_saheeh: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort,[905] and indeed We [i.e., Our angels], of it, are recorders.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So whoever does righteous good deeds while he is a believer (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism), his efforts will not be rejected. Verily We record it for him (in his Book of deeds).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: Whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer, his efforts will not be denied, for We are recording them all.

arabic_text: وَحَرَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ قَرۡيَةٍ أَهۡلَكۡنَٰهَآ أَنَّهُمۡ لَا يَرۡجِعُونَ
phonetic: 21.95 Wa Ĥarāmun `Alá Qaryatin 'Ahlaknāhā 'Annahum Lā Yarji`ūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [906]- They cannot return to this world, nor can they repent to Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: And it is prohibited to [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return[906]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And a ban is laid on every town (population) which We have destroyed that they shall not return (to this world again, nor repent to Us).
translations.english_rwwad: It is not possible for any town that We have destroyed to ever come back [to this world],

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُتِحَتۡ يَأۡجُوجُ وَمَأۡجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٖ يَنسِلُونَ
phonetic: 21.96 Ĥattá 'Idhā Futiĥat Ya'jūju Wa Ma'jūju Wa Hum Min Kulli Ĥadabin Yansilūna

translations.english_saheeh: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend
translations.english_hilali_khan: Until, when Ya’jûj and Ma’jûj (Gog and Magog)[3] are let loose (from their barrier), and they swoop down from every mound.
translations.english_rwwad: until when Gog and Magog are let loose, swarming swiftly from every mound,

arabic_text: وَٱقۡتَرَبَ ٱلۡوَعۡدُ ٱلۡحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِيَ شَٰخِصَةٌ أَبۡصَٰرُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَا قَدۡ كُنَّا فِي غَفۡلَةٖ مِّنۡ هَٰذَا بَلۡ كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 21.97 Wāqtaraba Al-Wa`du Al-Ĥaqqu Fa'idhā Hiya Shākhişatun 'Abşāru Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Yā Waylanā Qad Kunnā Fī Ghaflatin Min Hādhā Bal Kunnā Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [when] the true promise [i.e., the resurrection] has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the true promise (Day of Resurrection) shall draw near (of fulfillment). Then (when mankind is resurrected from their graves), you shall see the eyes of the disbelievers fixedly staring in horror. (They will say): "Woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this - nay, but we were Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: when the True Promise draws near, the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in horror, [saying], “Woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this; nay, we were wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: إِنَّكُمۡ وَمَا تَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُمۡ لَهَا وَٰرِدُونَ
phonetic: 21.98 'Innakum Wa Mā Ta`budūna Min Dūni Allāhi Ĥaşabu Jahannama 'Antum Lahā Wa Aridūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.21:98) When the following Statement of Allâh عز وجل was revealed: "Certainly you (disbelievers) and that which you are worshipping now besides Allâh are (but) fuel for Hell! (Surely), you will enter it."
The Quraish pagans were delighted and said: "We are pleased to be with our gods in the Hell-fire, as the idols will be with the idolaters (in the Hell-fire), and therefore ‘Îsâ (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary) will be with his worshippers (i.e. in the Hell-fire) and so on.
So (to clear the misunderstanding) Allâh عز وجل revealed the following Verse (to deny and reject their claim): "Verily, those for whom the good has preceded from Us, they will be removed far therefrom (Hell). [e.g. ‘Îsâ (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary); ‘Uzair (Ezra)]." [The Qur’ân, Verse 21:101].

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allāh are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Certainly you (disbelievers) and that which you are worshipping now besides Allâh, are (but) fuel for Hell! (Surely), you will enter it.[4]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, you and all that you worship besides Allah will be the fuel for Hell; you will surely enter it.

arabic_text: لَوۡ كَانَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ ءَالِهَةٗ مَّا وَرَدُوهَاۖ وَكُلّٞ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
phonetic: 21.99 Law Kāna Hā'uulā' 'Ālihatan Mā Waradūhā Wa Kullun Fīhā Khālidūna

translations.english_saheeh: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Had these (idols) been âlihah (gods), they would not have entered there (Hell), and all of them will abide therein.
translations.english_rwwad: If these [idols] had truly been gods, they would not have entered it. But they will all abide therein forever.

arabic_text: لَهُمۡ فِيهَا زَفِيرٞ وَهُمۡ فِيهَا لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ
phonetic: 21.100 Lahum Fīhā Zafīrun Wa Hum Fīhā Lā Yasma`ūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.21:100) Ibn Mas‘ûd رضي الله عنه recited this Verse and then said: "When those (who are destined to remain in the Hell-fire forever) will be thrown in the Hell-fire, each of them will be put in a separate Tabût (box) of Fire, so that he will not see anyone punished in the Hell fire except himself." Then Ibn Mas‘ûd recited this Verse (21:100). [Tafsir Ibn Kathir, Tabari and Qurtubî].

translations.english_saheeh: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therein they will be breathing out with deep sighs and roaring and therein they will hear not.[5]
translations.english_rwwad: They will groan therein with anguish, and they will not be able to hear anything.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقَتۡ لَهُم مِّنَّا ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰٓ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ عَنۡهَا مُبۡعَدُونَ
phonetic: 21.101 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Sabaqat Lahum Minnā Al-Ĥusná 'Ūlā'ika `Anhā Mub`adūna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, those for whom the good has preceded from Us, they will be removed far therefrom (Hell) [e.g. ‘Îsâ (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary); ‘Uzair (Ezra)].
translations.english_rwwad: But those for whom We have decreed the finest reward, they will be far away from it.

arabic_text: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَاۖ وَهُمۡ فِي مَا ٱشۡتَهَتۡ أَنفُسُهُمۡ خَٰلِدُونَ
phonetic: 21.102 Lā Yasma`ūna Ĥasīsahā Wa Hum Fī Mā Ashtahat 'Anfusuhum Khālidūna

translations.english_saheeh: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They shall not hear the slightest sound of it (Hell), while they abide in that which their ownselves desire.
translations.english_rwwad: They will not hear its slightest hissing, and they will abide forever in whatever their souls desire.

arabic_text: لَا يَحۡزُنُهُمُ ٱلۡفَزَعُ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّىٰهُمُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ هَٰذَا يَوۡمُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُمۡ تُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 21.103 Lā Yaĥzunuhumu Al-Faza`u Al-'Akbaru Wa Tatalaqqāhumu Al-Malā'ikatu Hādhā Yawmukumu Al-Ladhī Kuntum Tū`adūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [907]- The events of the Last Hour or of the Resurrection.

translations.english_saheeh: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror,[907] and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -
translations.english_hilali_khan: The greatest terror (on the Day of Resurrection) will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them, (with the greeting): "This is your Day which you were promised."
translations.english_rwwad: They will not be grieved by the Greatest Terror, and the angels will receive them [saying], “This is your Day that you were promised”.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ نَطۡوِي ٱلسَّمَآءَ كَطَيِّ ٱلسِّجِلِّ لِلۡكُتُبِۚ كَمَا بَدَأۡنَآ أَوَّلَ خَلۡقٖ نُّعِيدُهُۥۚ وَعۡدًا عَلَيۡنَآۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا فَٰعِلِينَ
phonetic: 21.104 Yawma Naţwī As-Samā'a Kaţayyi As-Sijilli Lilkutubi Kamā Bada'nā 'Awwala Khalqin Nu`īduhu Wa`dāan `Alaynā 'Innā Kunnā Fā`ilīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [908]- More literally, "Indeed, We are ever doers" of what We will.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.[908]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) the Day when We shall roll up the heaven like a scroll rolled up for books. As We began the first creation, We shall repeat it. (It is) a promise binding upon Us. Truly, We shall do it.
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when We roll up the heavens like a scroll of records. Just as We originated the first creation, so We will bring it back. That is Our binding promise, which We will surely do.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ كَتَبۡنَا فِي ٱلزَّبُورِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ ٱلذِّكۡرِ أَنَّ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ يَرِثُهَا عِبَادِيَ ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ
phonetic: 21.105 Wa Laqad Katabnā Fī Az-Zabūri Min Ba`di Adh-Dhikri 'Anna Al-'Arđa Yarithuhā `Ibādiya Aş-Şāliĥūna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[909]- Az-Zabūr can also mean "scriptures" in general.
[910]- i.e., the Torah.  The "mention" may also refer to the original inscription with Allāh, i.e., the Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).

translations.english_saheeh: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms][909] after the [previous] mention[910] that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We have written in Az-Zabûr [i.e. all the revealed Holy Books - the Taurât (Torah), the Injeel (Gospel), the Psalms, the Qur’ân,] after (We have already written in) Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz (the Book that is in the heaven with Allâh), that My righteous slaves shall inherit the land (i.e. the land of Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: We have written in the Psalms after the Preserved Record, that the land will be inherited by My righteous slaves.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي هَٰذَا لَبَلَٰغٗا لِّقَوۡمٍ عَٰبِدِينَ
phonetic: 21.106 'Inna Fī Hādhā Labalāghāan Liqawmin `Ābidīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, in this [Qur’ān] is notification for a worshipping people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this (the Qur’ân) there is a plain Message for people who worship Allâh (i.e. the true, real believers of Islâmic Monotheism who act practically on the Qur’ân and the Sunnah - legal ways of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a message in this [Qur’an] for devoted worshipers.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا رَحۡمَةٗ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 21.107 Wa Mā 'Arsalnāka 'Illā Raĥmatan Lil`ālamīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
